0.user_question: Carol was sending out birthday invitations to her friends. Each package of invitations she bought had 3 invitations in it and she bought 2 packs. If she wants to invite 9 friends How many extra invitations will she need to buy?

ost_step.2: She bought 2 packs, so she had 3 x 2 = 6 invitations.

direct_answer.text:
To find out how many invitations Carol already has, you calculated correctly that she bought 6 invitations from the packages she already purchased (since each pack contained 3 invitations and she bought 2 packs). But since she wanted to send out invitations to 9 friends, she still needs to buy some additional invitations. The difference between the number of invitations she wants to send out and the number she already has can be found by subtracting the number of invitations she already has from the desired number of invitations: 9 - 6 = 3.

So, Carol needs to buy 3 extra invitations to ensure she has enough for all her guests. The answer is: 3.
